issue.title: [C++] Improve precision range error messages for Decimal128Type/Decimal256Type
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-14842](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-14842). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The error message surfaces in R like so:
```r

decimal(0, 2)
Error: Invalid: Decimal precision out of range: 0
```
and
```r

decimal(100, 2)
Error: Invalid: Decimal precision out of range: 100
```
 
Could we improve the error message to be a bit more informative? As it is it doesn't specify what the range should be (1 to 38 for Decimal128Type, for example).
